original: Udāna 8.9
analyzed: udāna
translated: The Collection of Long Discourses 1

original: Paṭhamadabbasutta
translated: With Dabba (1)

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Atha kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā dabbaḥ malla puttaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā dabbaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Dabba the Mallian went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “parinibbānakālo me dāni, sugatā”ti.
analyzed: parinibbāna kālaḥ me dāni sugata ati
translated: and said, “Now is the time for my complete extinguishment, Well-Farer.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, dabba, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yassadāni tva dabba kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Now is the time for you to do as you see fit, Dabba.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā dabbaḥ malla putto uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇa
translated: Dabba then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him,🔽rose up into the air, crossed his legs in full lotus position,

original: katvā vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīditvā tejodhātuṁ samāpajjitvā
analyzed: katvā vehāsam abbhut gantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīditvā tejaḥ dhātum samāpajjitvā
translated: and entered the fire element.

original: vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbāyi.
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbāyi
translated: He emerged from the fire element and was completely extinguished.

original: Atha kho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa vehāsam abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena
translated: Then Venerable Dabba rose up into the air, crossed his legs in full lotus position,

original: nisīditvā tejodhātuṁ samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbutassa sarīrassa jhāyamānassa
analyzed: nisīditvā tejodhātum samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbutassa sarīrassa jhāyamānassa
translated: As his body was burning and being consumed,

original: ḍayhamānassa neva chārikā paññāyittha na masi.
analyzed: ḍayhamānassa na iva chārikā paññāyittha na masi
translated: no ashes or soot could be found.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma sappissa vā telassa vā jhāyamānassa ḍayhamānassa neva chārikā paññāyati na masi;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma sappissa vā telassa vā jhāyamānassa ḍayhamānassa na iva chārikā paññāyati na masi
translated: Just as when ghee or oil is burning and being consumed, no ashes or soot can be found;

original: evamevaṁ āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena
analyzed: evam evam āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa vehāsam abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena
translated: so too, after Dabba the Mallian rose up into the air,🔽sat down cross-legged in the air,

original: nisīditvā tejodhātuṁ samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbutassa sarīrassa jhāyamānassa
analyzed: nisīditvā tejodhātum samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbutassa sarīrassa jhāyamānassa
translated: and attained final Nibbana, as his body was burning and being consumed,

original: ḍayhamānassa neva chārikā paññāyittha na masīti.
analyzed: ḍayhamānassa na iva chārikā paññāyittha na masi iti
translated: no ashes or soot could be found.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: When the Buddha realized what had happened, he exclaimed:

original: “Abhedi kāyo nirodhi saññā,
analyzed: abhedi kāyaḥ nirodhi saññā
translated: “The body has been broken, perception has ceased,

original: Vedanā sītibhaviṁsu sabbā;
analyzed: vedanā sīti bhavisu sabbā
translated: All feelings have cooled down,

original: Vūpasamiṁsu saṅkhārā,🔽Viññāṇaṁ atthamāgamā”ti.
analyzed: saṅkhārā  viññāṇam attham āgama ti
translated: Conditions have subsided,

original: Navamaṁ.
analyzed: navama
translated: And consciousness has come to an end.”🔽The ninth section on Dabba the Mallian is finished.
